keyword: how many calories in a pound of ground beef
title: How Many Calories in a Pound of Ground Beef?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a pound of ground beef (80/20 lean), plus full nutrition breakdown, protein, fat, and cooking tweaks for better tracking.
h1: How Many Calories in a Pound of Ground Beef?
assumptions: Raw ground beef, 80% lean / 20% fat; 1 pound = 454 g; based on USDA data, no added seasonings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by fat content, brand, cooking method, and whether drained; raw vs. cooked affects totals. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: One pound of 80/20 ground beef contains about 1153 kcal and 78 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison; scaled from per-100 g basis to 1 pound (454 g).

tweaks.label: Cooked and drained (fat loss during browning)
Add 1 tbsp vegetable oil for cooking

faqs.q: How many calories in a pound of 80/20 ground beef?
faqs.a: Approximately 1153 kcal for raw 80% lean / 20% fat ground beef.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a pound of ground beef?
faqs.a: About 78 g of protein per pound of 80/20 ground beef.

faqs.q: Does cooking change calories in ground beef?
faqs.a: Yes—cooking and draining fat reduces calories to around 950 kcal per pound due to fat loss.

faqs.q: How much fat is in a pound of ground beef?
faqs.a: Roughly 91 g total fat, including 35 g saturated, for 80/20 raw ground beef.

faqs.q: Calories in leaner ground beef per pound?
faqs.a: For 90% lean, it's about 926 kcal per pound—lower fat means fewer calories.
